body_html:
@apaszke I'm not having luck with that.

import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

import io

torch.manual_seed(0)
v = Variable(torch.randn(3))
print(v)

buffer = io.BytesIO()
torch.save(v, buffer)
print(buffer)
print(torch.load(buffer))

gives me

Variable containing:
 1.5410
-0.2934
-2.1788
[torch.FloatTensor of size 3]

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test_torch_save.py", line 11, in <module>
    torch.save(v, buffer)
  File "/Users/samuelainsworth/Development/babar/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 134, in save
    return _with_file_like(f, "wb", lambda f: _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol))
  File "/Users/samuelainsworth/Development/babar/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 116, in _with_file_like
    return body(f)
  File "/Users/samuelainsworth/Development/babar/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 134, in <lambda>
    return _with_file_like(f, "wb", lambda f: _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol))
  File "/Users/samuelainsworth/Development/babar/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 203, in _save
    serialized_storages[key]._write_file(f)
RuntimeError: _write_file couldn't retrieve a file descriptor from given object

body:
@apaszke I'm not having luck with that.

```python
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable

import io

torch.manual_seed(0)
v = Variable(torch.randn(3))
print(v)

buffer = io.BytesIO()
torch.save(v, buffer)
print(buffer)
print(torch.load(buffer))
```

gives me 
```
Variable containing:
 1.5410
-0.2934
-2.1788
[torch.FloatTensor of size 3]

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test_torch_save.py", line 11, in <module>
    torch.save(v, buffer)
  File "/Users/samuelainsworth/Development/babar/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 134, in save
    return _with_file_like(f, "wb", lambda f: _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol))
  File "/Users/samuelainsworth/Development/babar/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 116, in _with_file_like
    return body(f)
  File "/Users/samuelainsworth/Development/babar/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 134, in <lambda>
    return _with_file_like(f, "wb", lambda f: _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol))
  File "/Users/samuelainsworth/Development/babar/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 203, in _save
    serialized_storages[key]._write_file(f)
RuntimeError: _write_file couldn't retrieve a file descriptor from given object
```
